trans-unit.source: Returns the results of a hit test that uses a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Geometry"></xref> as a hit test parameter.
You can also perform a hit test on a visual object by using a <xref:System.Windows.Point> as a hit test parameter, and return the result as a <xref:System.Windows.Media.PointHitTestResult>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GeometryHitTestResult"></xref> class by using a specified visual object and <xref href="System.Windows.Media.IntersectionDetail"></xref> value.
The visual object that is hit during a hit test.
Describes the intersection between a and visualHit.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.IntersectionDetail"></xref> value of the hit test.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.GeometryHitTestResult.IntersectionDetail%2A> property describes the intersection between a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Geometry> and the target visual object.
The following illustration shows the relationship between the hit test geometry (the blue circle) and the target object (the red square).
![Diagram of IntersectionDetail used in hit testing](~/add/media/intersectiondetail01.png "Diagram of IntersectionDetail used in hit testing")
The intersection between a hit test geometry and a target object
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.IntersectionDetail"></xref> value of the hit test.
Gets the visual object that is returned from a hit test result.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> object that represents the hit test result.
